issue.title: Windows 11: Containers page staying in "Loading..." status after snapshot restore
issue.body:
## Steps to reproduce

1. Start Rancher Desktop
2. Go to Snapshots page
3. Create a snapshot

---

1. Do a factory reset
2. Start Rancher Desktop again
3. Restore the created snapshot

## Expected Result

RD should be working properly after snapshot restore.

## Actual Result

I created and restored a snapshot as explained in RD-173 and RD-174. After restoring the snapshot I navigated to the Containers page and found it stuck in state "Loading...".

## Additional Information

- Test Case RD-173: Create Snapshots via UI
- Test Case RD-174: Restore Snapshots via UI

## Screenshot

![Screenshot_2023-10-27_13-02-59](https://github.com/rancher-sandbox/rancher-desktop/assets/8761082/730cea48-1f80-4a75-855b-a74199c3850d)

issue.title: Windows 11: Can quit RD while creating/restoring a snapshot
issue.body:
## Steps to reproduce

1. Start Rancher Desktop
2. Go to Snapshots page
3. Create a snapshot

---

1. Do a factory reset
2. Start Rancher Desktop again
3. Try to restore the created snapshot

## Expected Result

According to the RD-173 test case: "Tray menu options must be locked (except Open main window)", the "Quit Rancher Desktop" item should not be active and clickable. 

According to the RD-174 test case: "Tray menu options must be locked (except Open main window)", the "Quit Rancher Desktop" item should not be active and clickable. 

## Actual Result

While the snapshot is being created open the RD tray menu. The menu item "Quit Rancher Desktop" still appears to be active and clickable. Clicking "Quit Rancher Desktop" quits the application

Same applies to the restore operation. While restoring the previous created snapshot, the menu item "Quit Rancher Desktop" still appears to be active and clickable. Clicking "Quit Rancher Desktop" quits the application

## Additional Information

- Test Case RD-173: Create Snapshots via UI
- Test Case RD-174: Restore Snapshots via UI

## Screenshot

![Screenshot_2023-10-27_10-26-47](https://github.com/rancher-sandbox/rancher-desktop/assets/8761082/44807d62-6fca-40f1-b6d3-06dfc8c18e00)

![Screenshot_2023-10-27_12-09-03](https://github.com/rancher-sandbox/rancher-desktop/assets/8761082/731c1fb7-a6b5-4e59-8e47-c6d9afb42e6b)

pull_request.title: Bump github.com/google/uuid from 1.3.1 to 1.4.0 in /src/go/vtunnel
pull_request.body:
Bumps [github.com/google/uuid](https://github.com/google/uuid) from 1.3.1 to 1.4.0.
Release notes

Sourced from github.com/google/uuid's releases.

v1.4.0

1.4.0 (2023-10-26)

Features

  • UUIDs slice type with Strings() convenience method (#133) (cd5fbbd)

Fixes

  • Clarify that Parse's job is to parse but not necessarily validate strings. (Documents current behavior)
Changelog

Sourced from github.com/google/uuid's changelog.

1.4.0 (2023-10-26)

Features

  • UUIDs slice type with Strings() convenience method (#133) (cd5fbbd)

Fixes

  • Clarify that Parse's job is to parse but not necessarily validate strings. (Documents current behavior)
Commits
  • 8de8764 chore(master): release 1.4.0 (#134)
  • 7c22e97 Clarify the documentation of Parse to state its job is to parse, not validate...
  • cd5fbbd feat: UUIDs slice type with Strings() convenience method (#133)
  • 47f5b39 docs: fix a typo in CONTRIBUTING.md (#130)
  • 542ddab chore(tests): add Fuzz tests (#128)
  • 06716f6 chore(tests): Add json.Unmarshal test with empty value cases (#116)
  • See full diff in compare view

issue.title: docker-cli-monitor: make rancher-desktop-docker-cli release for version v24.0.7
issue.body: The Docker CLI monitor has detected a new release of docker/cli. Please make a corresponding release in rancher-desktop-docker-cli to keep it up to date in Rancher Desktop.

issue.title: Filesystem user mapping different than Docker Desktop

labels.name: area/volume
labels.description: Access to host volumes from inside the VM or containers

labels.name: triage/need-to-repro
labels.description: Needs to be reproduced by dev team

labels.name: parity/platform
labels.description: Feature is available on other supported platforms

issue.body:
### Actual Behavior

When using the VSCode remote-container plugin to open a project in-container, the files are owned by the external user instead of root. That is: file owning is not mapped from outside to inside.

I am creating this as a bug because in Docker Desktop for Mac the filesystem user is mapped from the local user to root, but in Rancher Desktop for Mac, it is not; since I understand we want to mimic this kind of behaviours from DD, I think it may be a bug

Also, it MAY be a bug in VSCode remote-container extension, but since it works on Docker Desktop, looks like the problem is in Rancher Desktop.

### Steps to Reproduce

I have created a simple test repository reproducing the error at https://gitlab.com/javier-sedano/user-map/-/tree/master

1. Clone the repo
2. Install VSCode (I am using 1.69.0 for Mac) and "remote - containers" (I am using 0.241.3)
3. Open the cloned folder in VSCode
4. It will offer to "Reopen in container"; do it

### Result

I see the following in a VSCode terminal:

```
root@61970ae95f98:/app# ls -lan
total 16
drwxr-xr-x 1 502 20  160 Jul 11 10:09 .
drwxr-xr-x 1   0  0 4096 Jul 11 10:07 ..
drwxr-xr-x 1 502 20  192 Jul 11 10:09 .devcontainer
drwxr-xr-x 1 502 20  384 Jul 11 10:10 .git
-rw-r--r-- 1 502 20    0 Jul 11 10:09 README.md
root@61970ae95f98:/app# git checkout
fatal: unsafe repository ('/app' is owned by someone else)
To add an exception for this directory, call:

        git config --global --add safe.directory /app
root@61970ae95f98:/app# 
```

Notice how files are owned by 502, which is my user in the host (my Mac).

This causes modern git to fail (causing the git view of VSCode to fail), for example, but other things fail as well.

My files in the host, outside the container:

```
javier.sedano@MacBook-Pro-de-admeis user-map % ls -lan
total 0
drwxr-xr-x   5 502  20  160 Jul 11 12:09 .
drwxr-xr-x  10 502  20  320 Jul 11 12:09 ..
drwxr-xr-x   6 502  20  192 Jul 11 12:09 .devcontainer
drwxr-xr-x  12 502  20  384 Jul 11 12:10 .git
-rw-r--r--   1 502  20    0 Jul 11 12:09 README.md
javier.sedano@MacBook-Pro-de-admeis user-map % 
```

### Expected Behavior

When using Docker Dektop for Mac, and following the same procedure, the following is shown in the terminal:

```
root@0036fc4efb35:/app# ls -lan
total 4
drwxr-xr-x  5 0 0  160 Jul 11 10:20 .
drwxr-xr-x  1 0 0 4096 Jul 11 10:21 ..
drwxr-xr-x  6 0 0  192 Jul 11 10:20 .devcontainer
drwxr-xr-x 12 0 0  384 Jul 11 10:20 .git
-rw-r--r--  1 0 0    0 Jul 11 10:20 README.md
root@0036fc4efb35:/app# git checkout
Your branch is up to date with 'origin/master'.
root@0036fc4efb35:/app#
```
And outside the container:
```
➜ user-map git:(master) ls -lan
total 0
drwxr-xr-x  [5 1425016936](tel:51425016936) 686672032 160 11 jul 12:20 .
drwxr-xr-x  [7 1425016936](tel:71425016936) 686672032 224 11 jul 12:20 ..
drwxr-xr-x  [6 1425016936](tel:61425016936) 686672032 192 11 jul 12:20 .devcontainer
drwxr-xr-x [12 1425016936](tel:121425016936) 686672032 384 11 jul 12:22 .git
-rw-r--r--  [1 1425016936](tel:11425016936) 686672032  0 11 jul 12:20 README.md
```


### Additional Information

_No response_

### Rancher Desktop Version

1.4.1

### Rancher Desktop K8s Version

Disabled (1.22.7)

### Which container runtime are you using?

moby (docker cli)

### What operating system are you using?

macOS

### Operating System / Build Version

12.3.1 Monterey

### What CPU architecture are you using?

arm64 (Apple Silicon)

### Linux only: what package format did you use to install Rancher Desktop?

_No response_

### Windows User Only

_No response_

comment.body:
> I see @jandubois has tagged with "need-to-repro"... Do you want us to have a meeting so I show you the failure?

The label means it is in the queue for somebody from the team to reproduce it locally (and ideally write a BATS test for it), but you are correct, in that nobody has worked on it yet. Once we repro it, it will be put into the backlog. If we can't repro it, we'll be asking more questions here.

Sorry for the long delay, it is definitely something I would like to see addressed, but we didn't have somebody available to repro/analyze it yet. 😞

### Actual Behavior

When using the VSCode remote-container plugin to open a project in-container, the files are owned by the external user instead of root. That is: file owning is not mapped from outside to inside.

I am creating this as a bug because in Docker Desktop for Mac the filesystem user is mapped from the local user to root, but in Rancher Desktop for Mac, it is not; since I understand we want to mimic this kind of behaviours from DD, I think it may be a bug

```
And outside the container:

total 0
drwxr-xr-x  [5 1425016936](tel:51425016936) 686672032 160 11 jul 12:20 .

drwxr-xr-x [12 1425016936](tel:121425016936) 686672032 384 11 jul 12:22 .git
-rw-r--r--  [1 1425016936](tel:11425016936) 686672032  0 11 jul 12:20 README.md
```

comment.body:
I Tested 1.10.1... no change.

I bet nobody is working on it. I see @jandubois has tagged with "need-to-repro"... Do you want us to have a meeting so I show you the failure?

issue.title: "Starting virtual machine" step fails due to SSH socket path being too long.
issue.body: Rancher Desktop shows the "Starting virtual machine" until timeout. `~/Library/Application\ Support/rancher-desktop/lima/0/ha.stderr.log` contains the following lines: ```json {"level":"debug","msg":"stdout=\"\", stderr=\"unix_listener: path \\\"/Users/od.andreas.zitzelsberger/Library/Application Support/rancher-desktop/lima/0/ssh.sock.Rcl2KoI2X03Sbknt\\\" too long for Unix domain socket\\r\\n\", err=failed to execute script \"ssh\": stdout=\"\", stderr=\"unix_listener: path \\\"/Users/XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX/Library/Application Support/rancher-desktop/lima/0/ssh.sock.Rcl2KoI2X03Sbknt\\\" too long for Unix domain socket\\r\\n\": exit status 255","time":"2021-10-14T15:28:04+02:00"} ``` with `XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX` being my user name. Please note that the path `/Users/XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX/Library/Application Support/rancher-desktop/lima/0/ssh.sock.Rcl2KoI2X03Sbknt` has 109 characters. The path length for Unix Domain Sockets is limited to 108 characters (Linux) or 104 characters (Mac). Unfortunately, my user name is managed and cannot be changed. While the user name is long, I believe it's length is not uncommon. **To Reproduce** * Start Rancher Desktop on a Mac with a user name that has 21 characters or more. **Result** Rancher Desktop shows the "Starting virtual machine" until timeout. **Expected behaviour** Rancher Desktop starts up properly. **Screenshots** **Setup (please complete the following information):** - macOS 11.6 - Rancher Desktop 0.6.0 - Kubernetes 1.21.5

issue.title: Restore snapshot from the UI fails when the snapshot contains a space
issue.body:
### Actual Behavior

I modified Test Case 173, calling the snapshot "Snapshot #1" instead of the suggested "snap1"

When I try to restore the snapshot in the  UI, I get an error message that Rancher Desktop «can't find snapshot "snapshot"»

### Steps to Reproduce

Create a snapshot in the UI (or with rdctl) called "Snapshot #1". 

### Result

Now try to restore it

### Expected Behavior

It gets restored

### Additional Information

I can restore the snapshot with `rdctl` from the command-line

### Rancher Desktop Version

1.11.rc1

### Rancher Desktop K8s Version

n/a

### Which container engine are you using?

containerd (nerdctl)

### What operating system are you using?

Other Linux

### Operating System / Build Version

n/a

### What CPU architecture are you using?

x64

### Linux only: what package format did you use to install Rancher Desktop?

None

### Windows User Only

_No response_

comment.body:
So the URL isn't being correctly escaped? 
I can create a snapshot called `99% invisible` (reference to a classic Reply All episode),
and `country & western` so maybe it's only the `#` character

comment.body: The problem is the hash character, not the space. See: Is the name send from the renderer thread to the background thread as a URL, so everything after the `#` is stripped as an anchor?

comment.body: I can't reproduce this on macOS; I can restore `foo bar` just fine from the GUI:

issue.title: Error: Invalid strategy "undefined"
issue.body:
Upgrading from ancient versions of Rancher Desktop (1.2.1) is broken:

```
2023-09-28T12:23:24.941Z: Error starting up: Error: Invalid strategy "undefined" Error: Invalid strategy "undefined"
    at ns (/Applications/Rancher Desktop.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/dist/app/background.js:43:72045)
    at /Applications/Rancher Desktop.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/dist/app/background.js:43:138167
```

We did remove the migration code that would show a prompt and let the user select the desired path management strategy, but assumed this would result in our `settings.json` migration to automatically pick `rcfiles` as the default value.

This does not seem to be the case, and it requires `rdctl factory-reset` to get back into a state where the UI will start at all.

We need to make sure that `rcfiles` is picked automatically.

comment.body: I was facing this issue and had to clean all files following https://www.suse.com/c/rancher_blog/clean-install-rancher-desktop/ and re-install RancherDesktop to resolve the issue.

pull_request.title: Don't prompt for sudo password when not required
pull_request.body: This makes it possible to run BATS with RD_USE_SOCKET_VMNET on hosts that allow passwordless `sudo`.

issue.title: Unnecessary Quit Prompt on Failed Snapshot Restore
issue.body:
Rancher Desktop prompts users to quit when a snapshot fails to restore, even when it doesn't require quitting. Users should only be prompted to quit if the failure results in a factory reset.

## Steps to reproduce

1. Create a new snapshot
	1. Navigate to Snapshots => Create Snapshot
	2. Give the snapshot a name and click Create
	3. Wait for Rancher Desktop to enter a ready state
2. Open the Restore Snapshot Dialog
	1. Navigate to Snapshots
	2. Click on Restore for the snapshot created in step 1
3. Create a snapshot vie CLI and restore via UI
	1. With the snapshot dialog still open from step 2, run `rdctl snapshot create Snap2` from the cli
	2. While the snapshot is creating, click on "Restore" in the snapshot dialog

## Actual result

The snapshot fails to restore and the user is prompted to "Quit Rancher Desktop."

## Expected Result

The snapshot fails to restore and the user is able to close the dialog without quitting Rancher Desktop.

## Screenshots 

![image](https://github.com/rancher-sandbox/rancher-desktop/assets/835961/00ce731f-3b57-444d-9567-285e6baf1a84)

comment.body:
> Alt+F4 works totally fine, so the bug is either there's no cancel button, or that we can cancel it even when we shouldn't be able to…

It is a bug if you can dismiss the modal dialog without quitting the application.

> There is also no obvious way to get rid of this dialog without quitting Rancher Desktop

We need to be able to include the information about the data reset (let's stop calling it factory reset) with the error message, like e.g.

```json
{"error": "restore failed because reasons", "dataReset": true }
```

That way the UI will now if the data has been reset or not, and can act differently depending on this value.

One thing that isn't clear to me right now: What does the UI do if the JSON stream includes multiple errors? Do we show all, or stop at the first one? Would we need to add `dataReset`  to all of them?

issue.title: Creating snapshot before app startup can hang
issue.body:
### Actual Behavior

If a snapshot is created, and then the app is started during the snapshot creation process, this can break the snapshot process.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. `rdctl factory-reset`
2. Start Rancher Desktop.
3. Quit Rancher Desktop.
4. `rdctl snapshot create abc`
5. _While the snapshot is still running_, start Rancher Desktop.
6. You should see a modal dialog when RD starts, noting that a snapshot is in progress. (This is correct.)
7. The snapshot never finishes successfully.

### Result

The `rdctl` process handling the snapshot exits with:

> Error: failed to restart backend: 401 Unauthorized: user/password not accepted

The UI still has the modal dialog (and it never goes away).

### Expected Behavior

The snapshot should (eventually) complete, and Rancher Desktop should be interactive.

### Additional Information

[Test case RD-178](https://app.qase.io/case/RD-178): Create/restore snapshot when app is not running

### Rancher Desktop Version

1.10.0-566-g9034e36d (1.11 RC1)

### Rancher Desktop K8s Version

N/A

### Which container engine are you using?

containerd (nerdctl)

### What operating system are you using?

Windows

### Operating System / Build Version

Windows 11 Pro 22H2 (Build 22621.2428)

### What CPU architecture are you using?

x64

### Linux only: what package format did you use to install Rancher Desktop?

None

### Windows User Only

_No response_

issue.title: Tray menu not disabled when starting with snapshot lock
issue.body:
### Actual Behavior

When Rancher Desktop starts while a snapshot operation is active, it is possible to use the tray menu to open the preferences dialog.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Quit Rancher Desktop.
2. Run `rdctl snapshot create abcdef`
3. Before the snapshot completes, open Rancher Desktop
4. (There is a modal dialog preventing interaction because a snapshot operation is in progress.)
5. While the snapshot is still ongoing, right click on the tray icon and select the menu entry to open the preferences window.

### Result

The preferences window opens, and the user can interact with it (including applying preference changes).  This can lead to downstream errors.

### Expected Behavior

It should not be possible to open the preferences window (or otherwise interact with the tray menu) while a snapshot operation is in progress.

### Additional Information

_No response_

### Rancher Desktop Version

1.10.0-566-g9034e36d (1.11 RC1)

### Rancher Desktop K8s Version

N/A

### Which container engine are you using?

containerd (nerdctl)

### What operating system are you using?

Windows

### Operating System / Build Version

Windows 11 Pro 22H2 (Build 22621.2428)

### What CPU architecture are you using?

x64

### Linux only: what package format did you use to install Rancher Desktop?

None

### Windows User Only

_No response_

issue.title: Unnecessary Quit Prompt on Failed Snapshot Restore
issue.body:
Rancher Desktop prompts users to quit when a snapshot fails to restore, even when it doesn't require quitting. Users should only be prompted to quit if the failure results in a factory reset.

## Steps to reproduce

1. Create a new snapshot
	1. Navigate to Snapshots => Create Snapshot
	2. Give the snapshot a name and click Create
	3. Wait for Rancher Desktop to enter a ready state
2. Open the Restore Snapshot Dialog
	1. Navigate to Snapshots
	2. Click on Restore for the snapshot created in step 1
3. Create a snapshot vie CLI and restore via UI
	1. With the snapshot dialog still open from step 2, run `rdctl snapshot create Snap2` from the cli
	2. While the snapshot is creating, click on "Restore" in the snapshot dialog

## Actual result

The snapshot fails to restore and the user is prompted to "Quit Rancher Desktop."

## Expected Result

The snapshot fails to restore and the user is able to close the dialog without quitting Rancher Desktop.

## Screenshots 

![image](https://github.com/rancher-sandbox/rancher-desktop/assets/835961/00ce731f-3b57-444d-9567-285e6baf1a84)

comment.body:
> There is also no obvious way to get rid of this dialog without quitting Rancher Desktop.

"Factory Reset" may be necessary when restoring a snapshot fails, so we prompt users to quit in order to avoid leaving Rancher Desktop in an unusable state. It looks like we have several cases where a restore can fail without requiring a factory reset and the UI can't determine why the process failed, only that it did. 

We might need to investigate how to relay when it's safe to cancel/dismiss on error and when quitting is necessary.

issue.title: OpenSUSE: Trying to create snapshot and start RD at same time fails
issue.body:
### Actual Behavior

I used this script:
```
#!/bin/bash

rdctl snapshot create abc4 --description "second snapshot for RD-178" &
sleep 3
rancher-desktop
``

When I run it, I get an RD startup error dialog telling me `limactl start` failed

### Steps to Reproduce

Create and run the above script. 

### Result

I repeatedly get this error-message dialog:
```
Error Starting Kubernetes
Error: /opt/rancher-desktop/resources/resources/linux/lima/bin/limactl exited with code 1
Last command run:
/opt/rancher-desktop/resources/resources/linux/lima/bin/limactl start --tty=false 0

Context:
Starting virtual machine

Some recent [logfile](app://./index.html#) lines:
    'github.com/nxadm/tail/util.Fatal({0x100b927?, 0xc000082ec0?}, {0x0, 0x0, 0x0})\n' +
    '\t/home/runner/go/pkg/mod/github.com/nxadm/tail@v1.4.11/util/util.go:23 +0x8b\n' +
    'github.com/nxadm/tail/watch.(*InotifyTracker).run(0xc00061d840)\n' +
    '\t/home/runner/go/pkg/mod/github.com/nxadm/tail@v1.4.11/watch/inotify_tracker.go:220 +0x65\n' +
    'created by github.com/nxadm/tail/watch.glob..func1 in goroutine 9\n' +
    '\t/home/runner/go/pkg/mod/github.com/nxadm/tail@v1.4.11/watch/inotify_tracker.go:55 +0x14e\n',
  code: 1,
  [Symbol(child-process.command)]: '/opt/rancher-desktop/resources/resources/linux/lima/bin/limactl start --tty=false 0'
}
```

### Expected Behavior

Not the error message

### Additional Information

No problem on Ubuntu. I've been seeing this error about the `watch/inotify-tracker` in openSUSE lately though.

### Rancher Desktop Version

1.11.0rc1

### Rancher Desktop K8s Version

n/a

### Which container engine are you using?

containerd (nerdctl)

### What operating system are you using?

Other Linux

### Operating System / Build Version

openSUSE Leap 15.5

### What CPU architecture are you using?

x64

### Linux only: what package format did you use to install Rancher Desktop?

None

### Windows User Only

_No response_

issue.body:
Rancher Desktop prompts users to quit when a snapshot fails to restore, even when it doesn't require quitting. Users should only be prompted to quit if the failure results in a factory reset.

## Steps to reproduce

1. Create a new snapshot
	1. Navigate to Snapshots => Create Snapshot

2. Open the Restore Snapshot Dialog

issue.title: Windows 11: Rancher Desktop Crashes During Create/restore snapshot when app is not running
issue.body:
## Steps to reproduce

1. Shutdown Rancher Desktop
2. After shutdown is complete, via CLI, create a snapshot by running `rdctl snapshot create ABC`
3. AND start the application WHILE THE OPERATION IS STILL IN PROGRESS

## Expected Result

When starting the application, the application's UI must be locked and needs to inform that the snapshot operation is in progress and the VM is still to start.

## Actual Result

Rancher Desktop starts, the UI is locked and informs that the snapshot is in progress, and a Kubernetes Error is raised. 

Closing the Kubernetes Error dialog leaves Rancher Desktop in a locked state with no way to dismiss the "Snapshot operation in progress" dialog.

## Additional Information

Test Case RD-178: Create/restore snapshot when app is not running

### Error Starting Kubernetes
```
Error: wsl.exe exited with code 4294967295
```

### Some recent logfile lines
```
2023-10-26T20:26:33.653Z: Registered distributions: rancher-desktop-data
2023-10-26T20:26:33.796Z: Registered distributions: rancher-desktop-data
2023-10-26T20:26:33.854Z: WSL failed to execute wsl.exe --import rancher-desktop C:\Users\phillip\AppData\Local\rancher-desktop\distro C:\Program Files\Rancher Desktop\resources\resources\win32\distro-0.50.tar --version 2: Error: wsl.exe exited with code 4294967295
```

## Screenshots

![image](https://github.com/rancher-sandbox/rancher-desktop/assets/835961/965d7145-f7cb-48f5-a519-350edf0f9aaa)

![image](https://github.com/rancher-sandbox/rancher-desktop/assets/835961/77188dbc-3b8a-4d72-8862-7d891b5017eb)

issue.title: Consistent Design for Dialogs in Rancher Desktop

labels.name: triage/next-candidate
labels.description: Discuss if it should be moved to "Next" milestone

issue.body:
Rancher Desktop currently has several dialogs with inconsistencies in terms of design, including button placement, title sizes, and the presence of various areas in a dialog. We should strive for a more unified and user-friendly experience across all dialogs.

## Proposed Solution

We should standardize the design of all dialogs within Rancher Desktop to ensure a cohesive user experience. This includes:

- Consistent, platform-specific button placement
- Standardized title sizes
- Well-defined guidelines detailing the Title, Description, & Buttons
- Identification of different dialog variations (Confirmation, Error, Dialogs that accept input, etc..)

## Additional Details

Here's a catalog of the existing dialogs used throughout Rancher Desktop:

### First Run

We talk about this as the "First Run Dialog", but does this fit into the categorization? We might be able to accept that this is a special case. 

![image](https://github.com/rancher-sandbox/rancher-desktop/assets/835961/f5452486-6aa1-4399-9854-a1c81cb9913f)

### Kubernetes Error

This error dialog can bet rather large, depending on the failure mode. The screenshot below is just an example that demonstrates the different areas in this dialog.

![image](https://github.com/rancher-sandbox/rancher-desktop/assets/835961/ed6765d5-de28-479b-ad81-df80ad7dbac2)

### Sudo Access

![image](https://github.com/rancher-sandbox/rancher-desktop/assets/835961/203c6f84-9728-4151-b739-db437a9804c2)

### Preferences

Similar to First Run, this acts as a dialog but can be considered its own application window. 

![image](https://github.com/rancher-sandbox/rancher-desktop/assets/835961/b300b4cc-bbf4-410d-bb1f-1b261f2ee6e2)

Preferences does display a native system dialog when attempting to close without applying changes

![image](https://github.com/rancher-sandbox/rancher-desktop/assets/835961/b88f1ed6-eb59-4dfa-83ac-93993fbb17f8)

### Factory Reset

![image](https://github.com/rancher-sandbox/rancher-desktop/assets/835961/46dbfb46-41ba-4283-8e9b-f09546d53097)

### Reset Kubernetes

![image](https://github.com/rancher-sandbox/rancher-desktop/assets/835961/e89c2d90-ed70-435a-b7f1-ec372ad3ed97)

comment.body: @manuelecarlini I updated the description with a real example of a Kubernetes Error dialog

issue.title: Unnecessary Quit Prompt on Failed Snapshot Restore
issue.body:
Rancher Desktop prompts users to quit when a snapshot fails to restore, even when it doesn't require quitting. Users should only be prompted to quit if the failure results in a factory reset.

## Steps to reproduce

1. Create a new snapshot
	1. Navigate to Snapshots => Create Snapshot
	2. Give the snapshot a name and click Create
	3. Wait for Rancher Desktop to enter a ready state
2. Open the Restore Snapshot Dialog
	1. Navigate to Snapshots
	2. Click on Restore for the snapshot created in step 1
3. Create a snapshot vie CLI and restore via UI
	1. With the snapshot dialog still open from step 2, run `rdctl snapshot create Snap2` from the cli
	2. While the snapshot is creating, click on "Restore" in the snapshot dialog

## Actual result

The snapshot fails to restore and the user is prompted to "Quit Rancher Desktop."

## Expected Result

The snapshot fails to restore and the user is able to close the dialog without quitting Rancher Desktop.
